title: Development of Experience-Based Mathematics Instructional Design Strategies Through a Dialogic Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Project designing a dialogic approach for pre-/in-service elementary teachers to convert mathematical experiences into learning

learning_goals: Learners can analyze real-world cases from math classes using a three-stage dialogic approach (reflective, appreciative, and generative dialogue) to derive instructional improvement strategies.
Learners can systematically reflect on their teaching experiences and connect them to learning theories through structured dialogue with peer teachers.
Learners can design, implement, and evaluate experience-based learning modules in small groups and apply them to PBL (Project-Based Learning) projects.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
